messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Interesting unschooly way to learn Japanese
messages.msgSnippet: Robin, please email us offlist with any ideas about unschooler exchange to Japan--Lauren is learning it like crazy right now and we are in trying to get
messages.messageBody:
Robin,
please email us offlist with any ideas about unschooler exchange to Japan--Lauren is learning it like crazy right now and we are in trying to get together a trip for her next year!

Dana

--- On Wed, 4/22/09, Robin Bentley <robin.bentley@...> wrote:

From: Robin Bentley <robin.bentley@...>
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Interesting unschooly way to learn Japanese
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Date: Wednesday, April 22, 2009, 4:16 PM

Thanks, Adrean!

My daughter loves manga and anime (currently expanding her bookshelf 
and DVD collection from just Inu-yasha <g>). When she plays either 
Pokemon DS games or World of Warcraft, she looks up names for her 
characters in Japanese. She has some DVDs in Japanese only and loves 
to sing along to Japanese pop songs.

We may have the opportunity to join friends in Japan next year (the 
older unschoolers are doing a home-stay in Tokyo and we are planning 
to join their mum for a holiday). This article is giving me some 
ideas....

Robin B.

On Apr 22, 2009, at 3:29 PM, Adrean Clark wrote:

> I found this article interesting -- maybe others will like the ideas
> of how one man learned Japanese and eventually moved to Japan. :)
>
> http://www.dannychoo.com/adp/eng/668/Learn+Japanese.html
>
> Adrean
>
>


------------------------------------

Yahoo! Groups Links








[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
